docs.lead_paragraph: TO THE LIVING SECTION: In her Personal Health column on diet aids (Nov. 9) Jane Brody attempts to assess the utility of phenylpropanolamine (PPA) for weight control. She essentially ignored the overwhelming scientific data on the safety and efficacy of this ingredient available over the counter for more than 40 years; e.g.: - More than 13 well-controlled clinical studies clearly demonstrate that patients taking phenylpropanolamine lost from 50 percent to 150 percent more weight, depending on the study, than those on a placebo, and equal weight loss compared to those on prescription drugs.
